So, I know that DW is built on playing to find out what happens. But, modules are also fun. Does anyone know of any DW modules like Servants of the Cinder Queen or the ilk? 
<div id='comment z13uw5by2rvuwfmpl04cftxpikirjhdp5mw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/115004060069742294090_photo.jpg'> Brandon Reinert</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-10-06 15:43:33 (edited: 2017-10-06 15:43:33)</cite></p>
        <p>Fortress of the Ur-Mage and Maze of the Elder Brain by @dungeonoracle are some of the best game design ive ever seen</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13uw5by2rvuwfmpl04cftxpikirjhdp5mw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/115004060069742294090_photo.jpg'> Brandon Reinert</h4>

        <p>Isn&#39;t that for D&amp;D 5e, <span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/115004060069742294090" oid="115004060069742294090">Brandon Reinert</a></span>.</p>

<div id='comment z13uw5by2rvuwfmpl04cftxpikirjhdp5mw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/113927217394445366066_photo.jpg'> Marshall Miller</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-10-06 17:29:22 (edited: 2017-10-06 17:29:22)</cite></p>
        <p>You might check out 20 Dungeon Starters. They&#39;re set up like a la carte menus so that you can preserve the &quot;play to find out&quot; aspect of DW while still having people, places, events, etc planned in advance.<br /><br /><a href="http://www.drivethrurpg.com/m/product/194173" data-embed="-hEsaHR0cDovL3d3dy5kcml2ZXRocnVycGcuY29tL20vcHJvZHVjdC8xOTQxNzM" data-attachment-render-hint="1" class="ot-anchor">http://www.drivethrurpg.com/m/product/194173</a></p>
</div>
